channel.title: Luxuries
channel.description:
Hey MiTB,
I don't know if you guys really care about this but I need a little guidance, or a tip from someone.
I want 3 things, I don't need them.
- A Yamaha WR250F. - Nissan Skyline GT R34. - New Gaming Computer.
First, before I get started. I'm [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?action=profile;u=560587]Skyro[/url] from MoparScape. This is the first time I've posted here. I've been on MoparScape for a while.
I'm 14, I want the Motorbike first. I can get the cash together so that isn't a problem. But I want the Car for my L Plates. That is about $12,000 AUD. After buying the motorbike I won't have any cash at all and to get $12,000 in 2 years is really hard for a 14 year old that can't get a job for another 9 months. Then after that, or before I want a gaming computer which can cost up to $3,000 AUD. I'm stuck because I want so many Luxuries but can't afford 2 of them. So what are some hints / tips to get money?
[i]Note: Sorry if this is the wrong section, first post. :) [/i]
Thanks,
Skyro. :)

item.title: Luxuries
item.dc:creator: @Uncalled Uncalled
item.description:
@Uncalled wrote:

[quote=“Ruby, post:37, topic:451033”]Wait, I just re-read this. You want a WR250F at 14? It takes me to handle one of those and even I made some pretty big screwups. I’m 6ft 2 and 194lbs, how on earth are you (a 14 year old) going to manage that?

You sir will not see your 15th birthday.[/quote]true.

Read full topic

I get 1,000 dollars for christmas each year and 500 dollars each birthday. Then I’m going to start woking after school and on weekends for extra cash.[/quote]What the hell you spoiled little… I’m perfectly happy with all of my possessions and I don’t get 500 between my birthday and holidays

item.title: Luxuries
item.dc:creator: @kronixz kronikz
item.description:
@kronixz wrote:

I know people that make $5000 a month from selling weed to highschoolers in my school.
They sell a freaking lot…

But if you don’t want to be risky, pull weeds and do landscape work for your neighbors, you can get like $100 a day.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

I realise it’s a matter of opinion but what a fantastic waste of money. I just hope you didn’t have to work hard for it.

Read full topic

item.title: Luxuries
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

If I’m honest, I wouldn’t want a Skyline for my first car. Go with something more classy, Evoque, a5, if you want a lot of speed hell get an RS-5. I would seriously advise against a GTR.

Also: I own a Rolex Submariner Date 2012 which cost me £7800, a TAG Heuer Grand Carrera GT which cost me £7150 and a Brietling Navitimer that cost me £4400. Trust me, the used watch market is very, very, very, very shitty. No-one buys them.

the bank:

I own two rolex’s. The oyster-perpetual day-date in gold and a silver submariner with a navy backing. Trust me when I say the market for used watches isn’t what you’d expect. Most people are just looking for raw metals to melt down and sell. The people who really have the money to buy these sorts of things usually choose to buy new.

Post a picture of your submariner?

A6e6RaQCQAAIkj3.jpg:large2048×1530

Read full topic

item.title: Luxuries
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Tree:

http://postmasculine.com/minimalism

Minimalist, yet owner of three Apple products. I know this criticism seems far fetched, but a true minimalist would buy as open source as possible. Heck, a true minimalist wouldn’t even own electronic devices.

Read full topic

item.title: Luxuries
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

Tree:

http://postmasculine.com/minimalism

I’ve seen this before and think this guy’s thinking is so flawed, whilst I like minimalism he just has become so minimalist he overlooks that the majority of the world has different lifestyles, thoughts and ambitions as him. When, of course, in actual fact his lifestyle caters to only a few niche, mostly travel oriented jobs for people who’d rather work than play. I want to call him a hipster but then I’d feel like some idiot redditor.

(Also Tyler Durden would laugh in his face, he completely missed the point of that book)

Read full topic

item.title: Luxuries
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

Driving that for a first car is just insane, here in the UK you’d pay about £10,000 just to insure that for a year, not only that but 1 in 5 drivers write off their first car, it’s just not worth it.

The computer and the bike may be possible, but thinking you can afford to both buy and run a nissan skyline is just stupid.

Read full topic

item.title: Luxuries
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

Go around cutting peoples lawns for 20 bucks a piece. Even if it takes you an hour each lawn (doubtful) youd be making 20 bucks an hour…

I made a lot of money when I was younger doing this, and did some computer repair when I was 16 too but didn’t like it because I hate explaining things to retards aka a customer wanting computer repair instead of running a fucking virus scan themselves. /rant

Read full topic
